DataElement.longName: Therapeutic Procedure Anatomic Site Uberon Identifier
DataElement.definition: The Uberon identifier for the location within the body targeted by a therapeutic procedure that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

DataElementConcept.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Named locations of or within the body.
DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes:
4/26/24 Released per CRDC DSS SN CADSR0003666. mr;
1/17/24 txfr ownership to CRDC for Uberon updates in associated CDE; existing PCDC CDE 13361747 associated with new DEC to better align with latest PCDC DD. jk;   4/24/2023: update the short name to match OC public ID and added Origin to DEC.wz

ObjectClass.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Medical care intended to treat or cure a condition or lessen its symptoms. This includes the administration of drugs, surgical procedures, physical or psychotherapy, or the use of therapeutic devices.

Property.definition: Named locations of, or within, the body.
Property.changeDescription: Updated to point to NCI Thesaurus concept code.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols and characters to capture the UBERON anatomic site code (ex: UBERON:0006209 or UBERON_0006209)._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueMeaning.definition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.

The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.

ReferenceDocuments.documentText:
1. Go to https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/uberon
2. Use the search field to search for your term.
3. Use the Copy button at the top of the search results to copy the Uberon ID.
